unit_learning_outcomes.description: Work effectively and professionally with a research supervisor, and other research collaborators as required, to plan a research project, including clear and pragmatic methodology that is appropriate to achieve the research aims. (Scientist and Scholar)
Effectively communicate a comprehensive understanding of a research topic, methodology and your own current research skills. (Clinical Practitioner)

Critically appraise the quality and contribution of current research evidence relevant to your research topic, to justify a research question relevant to contemporary physiotherapy and/or healthcare. (Scientist and Scholar)
Identify areas for and apply both independent and collaborative strategies to advance your research knowledge and skills relevant to your research project. (Scientist and Scholar)
Apply ethical principles within the national research regulatory framework to your own research practices.   (Professional)

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Project-specific research skill development including preparation and/or commencement of your research project.
Online resources will be provided to support the development of research skills and build a community of research practice.

enrolment_rules.description: (PHTY812 or PHTY8204) and (PHTY813 or PHTY8205) and (PHTY814 or PHTY8206) and (PHTY815 or PHTY8207)

assessments.description: You will set a learning plan to ensure you have the appropriate research and/or communication skills to successfully complete your research project.
You will prepare and write a research project plan, including a critical review of relevant literature.
You will provide evidence of achievement towards your learning plan.
You will deliver an oral presentation of your research project plan.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit will extend your research skills to develop a deep and contemporary understanding of methodological, regulatory and professional aspects of physiotherapy research. You will work closely with a research supervisor to integrate your professional, clinical and research skills to plan a research project. This will include justifying the research aims through thorough background research of the topic area, and clearly articulating the methodological process required to meet the research aims.
data.title: Advanced Research Training

description: This unit will extend your research skills to develop a deep and contemporary understanding of methodological, regulatory and professional aspects of physiotherapy research. You will work closely with a research supervisor to integrate your professional, clinical and research skills to plan a research project. This will include justifying the research aims through thorough background research of the topic area, and clearly articulating the methodological process required to meet the research aims.
title: Advanced Research Training
